column5: Gezz" I just heard a Kayak'er drowned off Toronto. Man' I hope your alright  . Living Legend just posted questions on here last week on going fishing in a Yak on Lake O. Guys going out on Lake Ont. in a Yak PLEASE be careful. Sitting here with my fingers crossed.
His profile says he was on here at 3:00PM today
Thanks Dan, sure appreciate it. Had me a little shook, just posting with the guy the other day.
WHOA! just saw this post now, Im all good but that's to bad about this kayaker. What happened?

BRIGHTON, Ont. – The body of a drowned kayaker has been pulled from the waters of Lake Ontario.  Northumberland OPP said that three Brighton, Ont., men were kayaking in Presqu’ile Bay around midnight Friday when one of the men fell into the water and didn't resurface.  An extensive search was conducted in the area where the 29-year-old fell into the lake.  OPP canines, a helicopter from Canadian Forces Base Trenton, locals with boats and police divers were involved in the search effort, which ended Saturday morning when the body was spotted, recovered and transported to the coroner.  None of men were wearing lifejackets when the kayaks tipped, police said.  Police have not said if alcohol was a factor in the drowning.  An autopsy is scheduled for Sunday.  http://www.torontosun.com/news/canada/2010/07/24/14816956.html
Going out on Lake O in the middle of the night, without a life jacket, ON A KAYAK????
No lifejackets, midnight and alcohol  Poor family.
Ya Im thinking alittle boozing was a factor here
Terrible news for the family.    Imagine getting that phone call.
Unfortunately you can't fix stupid! Feel bad for his family, loosing someone his hard.... especially like this.
stupidity at its best right there.  midnight, on a kayak, no life jacket?  and on a great lake????  my condolences to the family but this soooooo could have been prevented!

We can all look back at things we may have done differently and decisions we've made that afterwards made us scratch our head. I dont think that calling out stupidity at the time of someones death is necassarily called for.  I feel for the victim and the ones sitting somewhere grieving for their child/dad/brother

Well said Blague I'm sure that we all have done something stupid growing up. I still look back and consider myself lucky at things I've done. Still hurts when you lose a loved one. My condolences go out the the family
